name: PasswordPusher
description: An application to communicate passwords over the web. Passwords expire after a certain number of views and/or time has passed.

PWP__MAIL__ENABLE_LOGINS.description: Optionally enable the user login system.  Requires the mail and SMTP settings below.

PWP__MAIL__HOST_DOMAIN.description: The domain where your site is hosted.  Used to build fully qualified URLs in emails.

PWP__MAIL__MAILER_SENDER.description: The email address that sent emails are 'From'. e.g. 'Password Pusher' <pglombardo@pwpush.com>'

PWP__MAIL__RAISE_DELIVERY_ERRORS.description: Optionally raise exceptions when mail couldn't be delivered.

PWP__LOG_LEVEL.description: Application logging levels: debug, info, warn, error, fatal

WEB_CONCURRENCY.description: The number of webserver worker processes to run.

PWP__EXPIRE_AFTER_DAYS_DEFAULT.description: Default value for expire after days

PWP__ENABLE_DELETABLE_PUSHES.description: When true, passwords will have a link to optionally delete the password being viewed. When pushing a new password, this option will also add a checkbox to conditionally enable/disable this feature on a per-password basis.

PWP__DELETABLE_PUSHES_DEFAULT.description: When the option DELETABLE_PASSWORDS_ENABLED is set to true, this option does two things: 1. Sets the default check state for the "Allow viewers to optionally delete password before expiration" checkbox. 2. Sets the default value for newly pushed passwords if unspecified (such as with a json request)

PWP__ENABLE_RETRIEVAL_STEP.description: An option to require an extra click through to get to the actual password?

PWP__RETRIEVAL_STEP_DEFAULT.description: The default value for the 1-click retrieval step option.
